titleInfo.title: Telegram to Gov. James D. Porter from J.C. Hailey, mayor of Humboldt, Tenn. regarding yellow fever

mods.abstract: A Western Union Telegraph Company telegram to Gov. James D. Porter from the mayor of Humboldt, Tenn., J.C. Hailey. The mayor is reporting that the city of Humboldt is surrounded by yellow fever and the people are panic striken with no where to go. The mayor goes on to discuss the board of health recommending ""concussion"" and asking the governor to please send cannons for that exercise.

relatedItem.abstract: We're here to help you bring Tennessee history alive in the classroom! The Tennessee State Library and Archives (TSLA) is a great resource for educators and students seeking primary sources for use in the classroom. With extensive holdings in Tennessee, Southern, and regional history, TSLA is also the official repository for the permanent records of the State of Tennessee...
